<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Marut](/Monsters.aspx?ID=538)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

A marut is tasked with hunting mortals who cheat death by artificially extending their lifespans. This includes those who seek undeath, such as liches and vampires, but also includes those who use powerful magic to cling to their youth, use divination to discover and avoid an appointed death, or call too often on the power of resurrection. Once the marut has selected its target, the inevitable pursues its quarry without surcease or deviation until either it or the target is dead.

 Maruts seem to be carved from stone and clad in golden armor, yet they move with the deliberate grace of a creature made of flesh and bone. A marut never rushes, but its thunderous footfalls are relentless as it pursues its target. Though able to speak any language, the marut is taciturn even among inevitables.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Monitor](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 34

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 32

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 29
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Aeon_Marut.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 15">[Marut](/Monsters.aspx?ID=538)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="LN" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Large" />
<trait label="Aeon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=208" />
<trait label="Inevitable" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=223" />
<trait label="Monitor" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=111" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=32) pg. 10 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

**Perception** +26; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Languages**
[Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Infernal](/Languages.aspx?ID=19), [Utopian](/Languages.aspx?ID=36); truespeech

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +31, [Axis Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +22, [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=6) +27, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +29, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +26, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +28

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +8

**Dex** +4

**Con** +6

**Int** +1

**Wis** +5

**Cha** +6
</row>

**Truespeech** A marut can speak with and understand any creature with a language.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 37 

**Fort** +27 

**Ref** +25 

**Will** +26 

+2 status to all saves vs. magic
</row>

**HP** 230

, regeneration 15 (deactivated by chaotic)

**Immunities**
death effects, disease, emotion, poison, unconscious

**Weaknesses**
chaotic 15

[**Attack of Opportunity**](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3) <actions string="Reaction" />

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet; [_air walk_](/Spells.aspx?ID=6)

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
fist +30 ([Lawful](/Traits.aspx?ID=99), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d8+11 bludgeoning plus 1d6 lawful and fists of thunder and lightning

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 37
- **4th**
[Dimension Door](/Spells.aspx?ID=69) (at will)
- **5th**
[Command](/Spells.aspx?ID=45), [Locate](/Spells.aspx?ID=173)
- **7th**
[Fear](/Spells.aspx?ID=110), [Plane Shift](/Spells.aspx?ID=222), [Wall of Force](/Spells.aspx?ID=363)
- **8th**
[Chain Lightning](/Spells.aspx?ID=33), [Dispel Magic](/Spells.aspx?ID=78), [Earthquake](/Spells.aspx?ID=95), [Harm](/Spells.aspx?ID=146)
- **Constant (8th)**
[Air Walk](/Spells.aspx?ID=6), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Rituals** DC 36

- **3rd**
[Geas](/Rituals.aspx?ID=12)

**Final End**   The marut is anathema to beings that unnaturally extend their existence, including undead. Its fists bypass such creatures' resistances to damage and apply the creatures' highest weakness to damage. If a marut kills a creature that rejuvenates, like a lich or ghost, it always knows that the creature isn't fully defeated.

**Fists of Thunder and Lightning**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Incapacitation](/Traits.aspx?ID=93)) Each time the marut makes a fist Strike, it chooses either lightning or thunder. If it chooses lightning, the attack deals an additional 2d12 electricity damage and the target must succeed at a DC 33 Fortitude save or be [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 minute. If it chooses thunder, the attack deals an additional 3d8 sonic damage and the target must succeed at a DC 36 Fortitude save or be [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8) for 1 minute.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_4_RelatedCreatures.png">Psychopomp Allies</title>

The mandate of marut inevitables is similar to that of [psychopomps](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=83). Generally, the practical psychopomps are content to let an unyielding marut complete its mission and swoop in afterward to ensure the work has been done, but occasionally, they may work together.
</aside>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-2" />
